comment: The structure of her class is more focused on activities and discussions (pretty much completion) rather than test and quizzes. There are 2 exams and 1 final exam and they are HARD, most people in my class failed the tests as you cant really study for them. Ask for help on the reading responses and your grade will be saved. Also LOT of extra credit
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: Only gives 3 extra credit points through the whole semester. Her test are hard and very specific. Provides a list of the reading for written responses on the test but that doesnt help. Study guide just list the terms to study for so thats not helpful at all.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: The fact she needs to make stuff due at 6pm on a Friday night is beyond me. Why not make it due at 11:59 like every other professor ever? Her tests are also super hard for no reason. The study guides are soo many pages long, how are we supposed to memorize all that? She seems nice and all but it was a little ridiculous.
rating_tags: Test heavy--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: Believe the negative reviews before the positive!!! Professor Young is very sweet however her class is really hard. Lots of reading and the podcasts are lengthy and super boring. Tests are the most difficult and studying only helps about 50%. Also she only gives 3 pints extra credit and isnt very lenient.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Tough grader

comment: Tests are really hard and have required essay portions. There are a few essays, but she gives really good feedback on what you did wrong so you can improve. She does podcasts instead of lectures with slides, so make sure you listen or read the transcripts. There are easy weekly assignments too. As long as you put some work in you should be fine.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment: Don't take her at all. not trying to be rude but her lectures are literally as Siri is talking. test are hard. specific. very very tough grader. 3 test, gave 3 extra points, and just not a good teacher in general.
rating_tags: Test heavy--So many papers--Tough grader

comment: My favorite teacher so far. Fairly easy weekly assignments with some long essays based on readings. Gave extra credit throughout the year. I did my honors contract with her.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria

comment: Favorite professor so far. Fairly easy weekly assignments. Lots of extra credit throughout the year. I did my honors contract with her as well.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria

comment: she does too much for a history class. For instance, we have to write 3 papers and she wanted every aspect of the paper perfect- she looks for a thesis statement and all the extra stuff like its literature. test was hard( the multiple choice was hard ), plus she records podcasts. She's sweet but I wish she wasn't so serious .
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: She is a very good teacher. She clearly loves what she's doing. But she sure made us read when I took her online asynchronous class. She is an easy grader, except for the essays. On the bright side, we usually only had short discussion questions, surveys, or case studies due at the end of the week. 3 essays & a couple of tests total.
She doesn't communicate and is too strict. I made one mistake with my last assignment because I was at work and she gave me 0 for that.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Tough grader

comment: Essays are weighted the most so she grades those really closely. Tests arent worth much but we only did 3 including the final. You can listen to her lectures but they are boring so I read them. 5 essays. We did discussion posts on Microsoft teams which were pretty easy. She is a tough grader but once you understand what she wants youll be fine.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Gives good feedback--So many papers

comment: Dr. Young is a really good professor describing American History. The only issue I really had with her was the wording of her tests. The essays were fine for me, but just beware of how she words her questions and answer choices.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment: Her lectures aren't in PowerPoints. She writes the main topics down on the whiteboard with a few main pointers to go along with each. There are 4 papers to write based off of the readings in the book, & the lowest grade is dropped. Quizzes are given based off of the readings with the lowest 3 dropped. Attendance is also graded.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Amazing lectures--So many papers

comment: Worst teacher at Kennesaw, She is not very understanding. She doesn't allow people to use the bathroom during her class. She assigns 3 papers throughout her course.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: I ended up getting a B and when I asked for her to explain how because I was certain I'd be getting an A, she only told me to appeal my grade. She preceded to email the lady I email the appeal to and basically said she's wrong, I'm right, don't believe her. Tests are extremely difficult, papers are extremely difficult. Take on your own risk.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: She is a good teacher. A quiz every week but if you can answer the questions at the end of chapter in the book you will be perfectly fine. The test are worded in a difficult manner but still easy to pass. Paper, I struggled but made A's and B's. She is a great teacher! She even bumped my grade to an A when I had a 89 (some teachers dont)
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria

comment: I took professor Young for History 2112, and at first I thought it was going to be a crazy difficult class, but in reality, as long as you get the homework done and study you will be just fine. She is super caring about her students, and has made the transition from in-class to online class (due to COVID-19) so so amazing! I highly recommend!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Caring

comment: I learned so much from Dr. Young. She is very kind and accessible outside of class. I feel like I truly have an understanding of U.S. History after taking her class. I love Dr. Young and I wish I could take her for another class. She is very inspiring.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Inspirational--Caring

comment: Be prepared to read. As a student who's been around the block or two, I've had classes that had a lot of reading. I didn't expect her to assign D2L readings with an avg of 40+ pages. Who has time to read that much on top of other classes and a job? 2 papers, class discussion, and no final. Overall: it was alright at best. I've had worse.
rating_tags: Get ready to read

comment: The trick to her quizzes, 3 dropped, are looking at the questions at the end of the reading passages, she just rewords them. Quizzes are only 3 question. 4 papers, 1 dropped. She is kinda tough with the grading but go to her office hours to review your paper before you submit. 3 Test, you have to study but not that bad. She is a good professor.

Attendance is mandatory. If you are late, you cannot sign the sheet. There are quizzes and response papers due every week, although, if you really read the book, they are not that hard. There are 3 exams,which are pretty hard. I am a straight A student and I'm fighting hard to get an A in this class. And believe me I study...
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy

comment: I dont know how she got any good scores. She locks the door so you cant come late and if you leave to use the bathroom she wont let you back in. We have a quiz, paper, or test every week so be prepared for something. The only good thing about this class is she drops 3 lowest quiz grades and 1 lowest paper grade. Wouldnt take her again tbh
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: Just show up to class and pay attention. Professor young has a love for history and she shows it. You can pass the tests by knowing the key terms she posts on the study guide and their significance. She gives 4 response papers and drops the lowest one and these are fairly easy as well. Along with giving extra credit possibilities.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Caring

comment: All you really have to do in her class is listen and write down the notes that she already simplifies for you. She tells cool stories and knows a lot about what she's teaching which makes it fun to be in class. We did a couple of group activities but nothing hard. Show her respect and she'll give it back.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Caring

comment: all you have to do is listen & take notes shes really nice
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Gives good feedback--Caring

comment: Great teacher and super interesting lectures (and I normally hate history). Very accessible and open to questions. She is very nice and pretty chill.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Amazing lectures

comment: Shes sweet. A few in class papers you need to do but they're simple. Only a few things she grades you on, if you're interested in the class you'll do well but if you don't pay attention you probably wont pass. She likes free response questions so they're on all the tests, midterm and final, at least two
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things

comment: Pearl is an awesome teacher, she cares about what she teaches and she is a very intelligent woman. One thing I could say is if you take this class, participate in discussions as she likes to ask the class a lot of questions and enjoys getting discussions going so don't be those students that never have anything to say. Its a great class.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Inspirational

comment: Have enjoyed the class this semester, I think I would have made an A if I did not have so much of a crush on her!
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Beware of pop quizzes--Lecture heavy

comment: Really caring, she does given "attendance pop- quizes. Pretty straight forward and she is willing to work with you. the "give me liberty books" isn't mandatory you can still get a pretty good grade without it.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: Pearl was a great teacher. She diversified her grading curriculum with a few essays, the tests, and attendance which honestly helped cushion our grades. She even dropped the lowest essay grade to help us out. Honestly if you come to class, do your essays, and take notes during the lectures you will get an A.
rating_tags: Respected--Amazing lectures--Caring

comment: All around good choice. Relaxed, yet strict if that makes sense. She'll help you if you put in the work. Do your readings though, pop quizzes usually follow and that is also how she marks attendance.
rating_tags: Participation matters--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--Clear grading criteria

comment: Ms. Young is very animated which made History class both entertaining and intriguing. You have to do 5 Response Papers, the lowest one she drops. Come to class because she gives out pop quizzes and assignments.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--Amazing lectures

comment: Professor Young is a tough grader but once you start your assignments early and do it its entirety, you will get a get good grade. Her exam questions are based off her lectures. Sometimes the test questions are lengthy and tricky. Not a lot of assignments. There were only 4 response papers, 2 midterms and a final. In person she is really nice.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Participation matters--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Shes not an easy A. you will work HARD...

She was probably the best teacher I had this semester. Her lectures were very clear and her tests were a good representation of the material taught in class. Gives response papers every few weeks which she grades pretty tough and there is only 2 tests and a final besides that. She drops one test and paper. If you put in the work you'll make an A

She gives short essay assignments which are very easy but she is not very consistent on how she grades them. She gives you study guides for each test and as long as you know those terms you will get an A on the tests. Its an easy A as long as you put effort into it. I recommend going to all the classes and taking notes so you don't have to read.

While it was a lecture based class, Prof. Young was always incredibly animated and passionate about what she taught. If you take careful notes and do the readings and homework assignments, you won't have any trouble. She can get passive aggressive if people don't participate in class discussions, but overall a great teacher.

Her classes are all long boring lectures. Go to class and write down everything she puts on the board, and know it all like the back of your hand.. you'll do great. Personally I don't learn well from lectures but rather hands on learning, ill end up with a c in the class. Her classes are VERY boring, but it is history...
